newsitem.title: RUSSIA: Russian teachers turn wage protest on tourists.
newsitem.headline: Russian teachers turn wage protest on tourists.

text.p: A group of western tourists were treated to an unscheduled but authentic display of contemporary Russian culture when a group of country schoolteachers picketed their cruise ship complaining they had not been paid.

Interfax news agency said 30 teachers demonstrated as the steamer Belinsky docked at the picturesque village of Goritsy, a popular halt on week-long luxury river cruises between Moscow and St Petersburg. Foreign tourists typically pay around $2,000 -- more than two years' pay for a Russian teacher.
The protestors carried placards in English and German complaining that, like teachers across the country, they had not been paid for months. The tourists, however, were French.
